result.execSummary:
The defendant Tommy Lee Herman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment and/or schooling.

Submit to DNA sample.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless defendant hold valid Rx.  Submit to random urinalysis testing.  Undergo criminal thinking treatment.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

timeConds.notes: Jail to commence on or before April 8, 2016.  Transfer to Jefferson County Jail approved, per jail rules.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tommy Lee Herman in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI received, reviewed and no corrections to be noted.  Parties prepared to proceed today.  Previous plea to Count 1 & 3.  State begins sentencing argument.  Count 1- 3 years probation, 6 months conditional jail.  $518.00 costs.  DNA sample.  Count 3-6 months Sauk County jail, consecutive to conditional jail.  DNA sample, $443.00 costs.  Attorney Middleton gives sentencing argument and request court follow the PSI recommendation.  Defendant makes final statement.  Court clarifies eligibility for Substance Abuse Program only.  Court goes through min/max penalties.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
3 years Probation. Report to P&P by 3 p.m. March 9.  
Conditional Jail:  120 days Sauk County Jail, with huber/work privileges.  Jail to commence on or before April 8, 2016 at 6:30 p.m.  Transfer to Jefferson County Jail approved, per jail rules.  
DNA sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
AODA & treatment
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless defendant holds a valid Rx.
Seek and maintain full time employment and/or schooling
Submit to urinalysis testing
Undergo criminal thinking treatment per agent.  
$268.00 Fine/Costs & $250.00 DNA  (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 

Count 3:
Court withholds sentence.
2 years Probation, concurrent.
DNA sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
AODA & treatment
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless defendant holds a valid Rx.
Seek and maintain full time employment and/or schooling
Submit to urinalysis testing
Undergo criminal thinking treatment per agent.  
$243.00 Fine/Costs and $200.00 DNA surcharge (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Tommy Lee Herman in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendation.  Plea to Count 1 & 3.  Dismiss/read in Count 2, 4 & 5.  PSI requested.  Attorney Middleton agrees as noted by the State.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No contest plea entered to Count 1 & 3.  Guilty plea filed by Attorney Middleton.  Court goes through guilty plea with defendant.  Defendant agrees and understands.  PSI to be filed by Feb. 12, 2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Tommy Lee Herman in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial br. 1.  Bond continues.
Defendant Tommy Lee Herman in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.

Pre-trial conference on February 13, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Tommy Lee Herman appeared by video means with Attorney Middleton. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Defendant does qualify. Address of defendant is correct.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $1500.00 cash bond with conditions.  Request signature bond.  Case in another county close to resolution.  Time limits waived. $1000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times.  No contact with B.B.  May pick up personal property one time with law enforcement and upon notice.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 09:45 am.  Return date scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
